Evolphin is primarily focused on media
asset management workflows.

Our customers have been migrating
or looking at migrating to the cloud

and the pandemic
just accelerated that whole thing.

Now, the problem with the media
workflows that we tackle, they

generate a lot of data,
so you could have peta

bytes of video
footages, millions of images.

There are a lot of on-prem systems, trans
coders and storages that are optimized
for editing and producing, doing
post-production of these media files.

When these customers started
to think about migrating to the cloud,
there were a couple of challenges.

One was the cost of migrating
all of this data into the cloud.
The second issue

that customers had was they know
that they have to move to the cloud,

but how do they move to the cloud
with all these factors.

Security is a big concern
with these customers.

So we were able to set up security
groups and VPC (Virtual Private Cloud) in the cloud

to essentially give them an isolated
environment as a single tenant,
which is really big for these customers.

So we had to pivot from an
application that was optimized
for on-prem with monolithic components,
to a more microservices based architecture

in the cloud, taking advantage
of all the offerings that AWS has,

to create a highly secure
and a performance solution in the cloud.

Once we migrated the solution
to the cloud, all the storages,

transcoders, all the GPUs are in the cloud
and it's very easy to monitor them.
It's very easy to maintain those systems.
So we have customers that are non-profits,
really small businesses

with like 5 or 10 people
in the creative team using technologies

that we have created and combination
of the services that AWS offers.

That total cost of ownership
of our solution can be far less than what

they would do by putting together
ad hoc solutions or outsourcing IT.
And so working with our AWS partner team,

we basically created a workflow that uses a combination of
AWS Snowball as well as Direct Connect to
accelerate the movement of data from on-prem into the cloud.

So Evolphin is a small to medium business,
but it's rapidly evolving

and we have a lot of innovative workflows
that we are bringing to the table.

And with AWS, we were able to work
out plans that made it cost effective.
